text: Wang Zhiliang (; 1941 - 15 September 2020) was a Chinese table tennis player and coach. At the 1963 World Table Tennis Championships, he and partner Zhang Xielin became the first Chinese duo to win the men's doubles gold medal in world championships. He was born in Xushui District, China. Wang died on 15 September 2020 from a stroke in Beijing at the age of 79.世界冠军王志良因病去世 中国首个世乒赛男双冠军 ==References== Category:1941 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Chinese table tennis players Category:Deaths from stroke
title: Wang Zhiliang
